tree.title: FC1200 (OB1)
tree.notes:
Important DBs:
parameters:
200 MC_Para_Com - General Parameters
205 MCC_Para - Common Supply In and Out Para
206 MCC_Para_ESupply - Emergency supply
209-242 Segments Parameters
1551 - Special Para - shared with other cooling 


Data:
201 MC_Data_in - input signals (OMO, common suplpy)
202 MC_Data_Master - package statuses
203 MC_Data_Com - signals (HMI modes, alarms, status)
207 MCC_Data - Common part data
208 MCC_Data_ESupply - ESupply  Data
249-282 Segments Data
1552 - Special Data - shared with other cooling 

Additional notes:
Tank level/pressure in FC1223 NW3

children.title: FB1206 Strand Part
children.notes:
Project specific:
In Angang there are flow switches instead of flowmeters. 
Here they are all read and copied to DB270 for HMI - no further processing is done with it as of now

children.title: FC1225 MCS_Strand
children.notes:
Bunch of calls to the FB915, which evaluates a pair of measurements (two flows, temp, pressure or whatever)

The measurement evaluation sets the alarms based on the given parameters and does some diagnosit, although software written with bunch of indirect addressing and calls from STL which makes it non commissionable

DBs 209-242 are used with parameters
DBs 249-282 are used for data IN and OUT (for example value is read (set before in FC1205) and limits are outputted here)
children.flags: [true,false,false,false,false,false,false,false,false]

children.title: FB1295 MC_SumSign
children.description: generation of all ready signals in loop
children.notes:
Generates all the ready signals. Structure is misleading as at first the signals are being used, that are later on generated.
The evaluation of the segment specific data is done in a loop

This will need to be modified for ANGANG project
